content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are given a markdown-formatted text `md`. Write a function `q_and_a_extractor` to extract all text in the markdown sections Question and Answer (starting with `# Question` and `# Answer`, respectively) and return the answer in a tuple like `(question,answer)`. Strip any leading spaces and newlines from the extracted text.

Here's how you can implement this function:

```julia
function q_and_a_extractor(md::String)
    # Split the markdown into lines
    lines = split(md, '\n')
    
    question = ""
    answer = ""
    inQuestionSection = false
    inAnswerSection = false
    
    for line in lines
        if startswith(line, "# Question")
            inQuestionSection = true
            continue
        end
        
        if startswith(line, "# Answer")
            inAnswerSection = true
            continue
        end
        
        if inQuestionSection && !startswith(line, " ")
            # This is the start of a new question section. Reset the question text
            inQuestionSection = false
            
        elseif inQuestionSection
            # Add this line to the question text
            question *= strip(line)
        
        end
        
        if inAnswerSection && !startswith(line, " ")
            # This is the start of a new answer section. Reset the answer text
            inAnswerSection = false
            
        elseif inAnswerSection
            # Add this line to the answer text
            answer *= strip(line)
        
        end
    end
    
    return (question, answer)
end
```
This function goes through each line of the markdown. If it encounters a line starting with "# Question", it starts recording the question in `question`. Similarly, if it sees a line starting with "# Answer", it starts recording the answer in `answer`. It continues to record until it encounters another section header (i.e., a line that doesn't start with " ").

Note: This function assumes that there is only one question and one answer in the markdown, and that there are no other sections starting with "# Question" or "# Answer". If your markdown has multiple questions/answers or additional sections, you may need to modify this code to handle those cases appropriately.
